Build ID: 3.2.2

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Open the help system.
2.Type a search term in the Search field and then click GO.
3.When the indexing is complete, open the PDE Runtime Error Log. Multiple internal errors are reported while trying to index welcome experience plug-ins.


More information:
Here is a sample of one such error:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.help.base 4 4 2007-04-10 12:23:17.593
!MESSAGE Help documentation could not be indexed completely.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.help.base 4 4 2007-04-10 12:23:17.593
!MESSAGE An unexpected internal error occurred while adding 
document /com.ibm.tpf.toolkit.welcome.java/tpfconnect to index D:\TPF Toolkit 
V32\eclipse\configuration\org.eclipse.help.base\index\en_CA.
!STACK 0
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: value cannot be null
		 at org.apache.lucene.document.Field.<init>(Field.java:174)
		 at org.apache.lucene.document.Field.UnStored(Field.java:121)
		 at org.apache.lucene.document.Field.UnStored(Field.java:115)
		 at org.eclipse.help.search.LuceneSearchParticipant.addTitle
(LuceneSearchParticipant.java:161)
		 at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.intro.impl.model.IntroSearchParticipant.addChildren
(IntroSearchParticipant.java:188)

I have sent a small set of my welcome plug-ins to Curtis D'Entremont and Chris Goldthorpe via email so that these can be used to recreate the problem.

I looked at the files you sent and the root cause of the problem is a page with an empty title:

administratorOverview.xml contains this section of xml:

  <page 
		style="$theme$/html/overview.css, css/overview.css" 
		alt-style="css/content-swt.properties" 
		id="actionsandmenus" 
		style-id="page">
		<title style-id="intro-header"></title>

If you change the title to have a value the problem will go away, for example.

<title style-id="intro-header">Intro Header</title>

Eclipse 3.3 also generates the same null pointer exception. I'll go ahead and change the code in Eclipse 3.3 to not generate an error in this situation when building the search index, for Eclipse 3.2.2 you will need to set the title.
